html.p: In Splunk 6.2, we’ve completely remodeled the pages and workflows for adding data, including new features like Forwarder Inputs and a new version of Data Preview.

We’ve made it much easier to find your way to the appropriate input configuration. Instead of selecting from a confusing list of sources, start with a simple choice of “upload, monitor, or forward” and you’ll find yourself in a simple wizard-style workflow of defining the appropriate parameters for the data you want to add.

With Forwarder Inputs, you are able to push input configurations to Splunk instances configured as deployment clients. Simply select one or more forwarders, provide a group name, and you’ll be able to create data inputs on them in the same way you create inputs through the UI on your indexers.

The new data preview utility will make it easier for you to create the right sourcetype for your data. In the advanced section, you’ll be able to choose a charset from a list, and see how changes you make to your sourcetype are reflected in props.conf.

In order to better choose the appropriate sourcetype when adding data we built a new sourcetype picker, which includes categories and descriptions. To add categories and descriptions to your sourcetypes, modify the sourcetype_metadata.conf file. [docs link]
Not sure what the recommended configurations are, or how to use a specific parameter? We’ve got you covered, with FAQs on each step of the way while you add data to Splunk!
